intro: Icacorea guancheana, commonly known as the Canary Island hibiscus, is a shrub native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid and saline conditions of its native habitat. Icacorea guancheana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
